com.nhaarman.listviewanimations.itemmanipulation

Class AnimateAdditionAdapter<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.widget.BaseAdapter
      • com.nhaarman.listviewanimations.BaseAdapterDecorator
        • com.nhaarman.listviewanimations.itemmanipulation.AnimateAdditionAdapter<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Adapter, ListAdapter, SectionIndexer, SpinnerAdapter, ListViewSetter, DynamicListView.Swappable

    public class AnimateAdditionAdapter<T>
extends BaseAdapterDecorator
    An EXPERIMENTAL adapter for inserting rows into the ListView with an animation. The root BaseAdapter should implement AnimateAdditionAdapter.Insertable, otherwise an IllegalArgumentException is thrown. This class only works with an instance of ListView!

    Usage:
    - Wrap a new instance of this class around a BaseAdapter.
    - Set a ListView to this class using setListView(android.widget.ListView).
    - Call insert(int, Object) to animate the addition of an item.

    Extend this class and override getAdditionalAnimators(android.view.View, android.view.ViewGroup) to provide extra Animators.

      • insert

        public void insert(int index,
          T item)
        Insert an item at given index. Will show an entrance animation for the new item if the newly added item is visible. Will also call AnimateAdditionAdapter.Insertable.add(int, Object) of the root BaseAdapter.
        Parameters:
        index - the index the new item should be inserted at
        item - the item to insert

      • insert

        public void insert(Pair<Integer,T>... indexItemPairs)
        Insert items at given indexes. Will show an entrance animation for the new items if the newly added item is visible. Will also call AnimateAdditionAdapter.Insertable.add(int, Object) of the root BaseAdapter.
        Parameters:
        indexItemPairs - the index-item pairs to insert. The first argument of the Pair is the index, the second argument is the item.

      • insert

        public void insert(Iterable<Pair<Integer,T>> indexItemPairs)
        Insert items at given indexes. Will show an entrance animation for the new items if the newly added item is visible. Will also call AnimateAdditionAdapter.Insertable.add(int, Object) of the root BaseAdapter.
        Parameters:
        indexItemPairs - the index-item pairs to insert. The first argument of the Pair is the index, the second argument is the item.

      • getAdditionalAnimators

        protected com.nineoldandroids.animation.Animator[] getAdditionalAnimators(View view,
                                                              ViewGroup parent)
        Override this method to provide additional animators on top of the default height and alpha animation.
        Parameters:
        view - The View that will get animated.
        parent - The parent that this view will eventually be attached to.
        Returns:
        a non-null array of Animators.
